services.name: Twitter / X
services.description: Social media platform for microblogging and real-time updates

events.title: Free API tier removed
events.description: Twitter removed free API access, forcing developers and researchers to paid plans starting at $100/month, effectively killing many third-party tools and academic research projects.

events.title: Verification system changed to paid subscription
events.description: Twitter replaced its verified badge system with a paid subscription model, removing credibility indicators and allowing anyone to purchase verification regardless of authenticity.

events.title: Third-party app API pricing made prohibitively expensive
events.description: Reddit announced API pricing that would cost popular third-party apps like Apollo over $20 million annually, effectively forcing them to shut down and pushing users to the official app.

events.title: Forced reopening of protesting subreddits
events.description: Reddit forcibly reopened subreddits that had gone private in protest of API changes, removing moderators who refused to comply and demonstrating disregard for community governance.

events.title: Aggressive ad-blocker detection and restrictions
events.description: YouTube began aggressively detecting and blocking users with ad-blockers, forcing them to disable ad-blocking extensions or purchase YouTube Premium to continue watching videos.

events.title: Premium Lite tier discontinued in Europe
events.description: YouTube discontinued its affordable Premium Lite subscription tier in Europe, forcing users to either watch ads or pay significantly more for full Premium.
